verses.kjv: Hear ye now what the LORD saith; Arise, contend thou before the mountains, and let the hills hear thy voice.
verses.ct: Listen to what the LORD says: "Stand up and present your case before the mountains, and let the hills hear your voice."

verses.kjv: Hear ye, O mountains, the LORD’s controversy, and ye strong foundations of the earth: for the LORD hath a controversy with his people, and he will plead with Israel.
verses.ct: Mountains, listen to the LORD's accusation — you too, enduring foundations of the earth — because the LORD has a case against his people, and he is bringing charges against Israel.

verses.kjv: O my people, what have I done unto thee? and wherein have I wearied thee? testify against me.
verses.ct: "My people, what have I done to you? How have I burdened you? Answer me!

verses.kjv: For I brought thee up out of the land of Egypt, and redeemed thee out of the house of servants; and I sent before thee Moses, Aaron, and Miriam.
verses.ct: I brought you up out of Egypt and freed you from slavery. I sent Moses, Aaron, and Miriam to lead you.

verses.kjv: O my people, remember now what Balak king of Moab consulted, and what Balaam the son of Beor answered him from Shittim unto Gilgal; that ye may know the righteousness of the LORD.
verses.ct: My people, remember what Balak king of Moab schemed, and how Balaam son of Beor responded to him — remember what happened from Shittim to Gilgal — so that you may recognize the righteousness of the LORD."

verses.kjv: Wherewith shall I come before the LORD, and bow myself before the high God? shall I come before him with burnt offerings, with calves of a year old?
verses.ct: What should I bring when I come before the LORD and bow down before the exalted God? Should I come to him with burnt offerings, with year-old calves?

verses.kjv: Will the LORD be pleased with thousands of rams, or with ten thousands of rivers of oil? shall I give my firstborn for my transgression, the fruit of my body for the sin of my soul?
verses.ct: Would the LORD be pleased with 1,000s of rams, or with 10,000 rivers of olive oil? Should I offer my firstborn child for my wrongdoing, my own flesh and blood for the sin of my soul?

verses.kjv: He hath shewed thee, O man, what is good; and what doth the LORD require of thee, but to do justly, and to love mercy, and to walk humbly with thy God?
verses.ct: He has already shown you, humanity, what is good. And what does the LORD require of you? Simply this: act justly, love mercy, and walk humbly with your God.

verses.kjv: The LORD’s voice crieth unto the city, and the man of wisdom shall see thy name: hear ye the rod, and who hath appointed it.
verses.ct: The LORD's voice calls out to the city — and it is wise to respect his name — "Pay attention to the rod of punishment, and to the one who appointed it.

verses.kjv: Are there yet the treasures of wickedness in the house of the wicked, and the scant measure that is abominable?
verses.ct: Can I overlook the ill-gotten treasures still stored in the houses of the wicked, and the dishonest short measures that I despise?

verses.kjv: Shall I count them pure with the wicked balances, and with the bag of deceitful weights?
verses.ct: Can I consider anyone innocent who uses rigged scales and bags of false weights?

verses.kjv: For the rich men thereof are full of violence, and the inhabitants thereof have spoken lies, and their tongue is deceitful in their mouth.
verses.ct: The wealthy people of this city are full of violence, its residents speak lies, and their tongues are nothing but deception.

verses.kjv: Therefore also will I make thee sick in smiting thee, in making thee desolate because of thy sins.
verses.ct: So I have already begun to strike you down and devastate you because of your sins.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt eat, but not be satisfied; and thy casting down shall be in the midst of thee; and thou shalt take hold, but shalt not deliver; and that which thou deliverest will I give up to the sword.
verses.ct: You will eat but never feel satisfied; emptiness will remain inside you. You will try to save things up, but you won't be able to rescue them — and whatever you do manage to save, I will hand over to the sword.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt sow, but thou shalt not reap; thou shalt tread the olives, but thou shalt not anoint thee with oil; and sweet wine, but shalt not drink wine.
verses.ct: You will plant crops but never harvest them. You will press olives but never use the oil. You will crush grapes but never drink the wine.

verses.kjv: For the statutes of Omri are kept, and all the works of the house of Ahab, and ye walk in their counsels; that I should make thee a desolation, and the inhabitants thereof an hissing: therefore ye shall bear the reproach of my people.
verses.ct: You have followed the practices of Omri and all the ways of Ahab's dynasty, living by their advice. So I will turn you into a wasteland and your people into an object of mockery. You will carry the disgrace that my people deserve."
